text.text_translated:
A rover looks at the air on Mars. It does this often.
In 2014, the rover found methane in the air. This was another discovery.
Methane is a very simple molecule. It is an organic molecule. Organic molecules are important for life.
Methane is also a gas in natural gas.
Methane does not stay for a long time. It only lives for a few hundred years.
So, something on Mars makes new methane.
NASA says Mars makes many thousands of tons of methane at one time.
The amount of methane goes up and down. This happens with the seasons.
It is like the planet Mars breathes.

feedback.feedback: FAIL: Meaning Preservation Failure. The MeaningBERT score of 0.696 is below the required 0.75. The writer's output introduces new information not present in the original text, specifically 'Organic molecules are important for life'. This addition alters the core message. Furthermore, the nuance of methane being 'another of the most basic organic molecules' is lost, replaced by the less specific 'This was another discovery' and 'Methane is a very simple molecule. It is an organic molecule.' The original's emphasis on methane's fundamental nature as a basic organic molecule is not fully preserved. Suggestion: Remove information not present in the original text. Ensure all key attributes of methane mentioned in the original are accurately and simply conveyed.

best_attempt.text_translated:
A rover looks at the air on Mars. It does this often.
In 2014, the rover found a gas in the air. This gas is methane.
Methane is a very simple gas. It is a basic part of life. It is also in natural gas.
Methane does not stay for a long time. It only stays for a few hundred years.
This shows that something on Mars makes more methane all the time.
NASA says Mars sends out thousands of tons of methane at a time.
The amount of methane goes up and down. This happens at different times of the year.
It is like the planet Mars takes air in and out.
